alert.note: Alert for Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 3:48PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Natrona and south central Johnson Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 348 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles south of Kaycee, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Natrona and south central Johnson Counties. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 236 and 240. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County
